inlineContent.text: The payment authorization controller.
The selected shipping method. This parameter contains one of the shipping methods included in the payment request.
The completion block to call with the updated payment summary items.
This block takes the following parameters:
The authorization status for the payment. For values, see
An array of
objects that replaces the summary items for the current payment request.
Use this method to update shipping costs based on the shipping address selected by the user, as previously passed to the delegate in the
method. If no address has been selected, use the prepopulated address on the payment request.
When this method is called, you create a new array of
objects that represent the updated cost including shipping. For more information on creating summary items, see the
class’s
property.
The delegate receives no further callbacks except
until it has invoked the completion block.

abstract.text: Process Apple Pay payments in your app, and create and distribute passes for the Wallet app.
An object that presents a sheet that prompts the user to authorize a payment request.
Methods that let you respond to user interactions with your payment authorization controller.
Tells the delegate that the user selected a shipping address.
Tells the delegate that the user selected a shipping address.
Tells the delegate that the user selected a shipping method.
Tells the delegate that the user selected a shipping method.
Tells the delegate that payment authorization has completed.
General success and failure status for payment authorization.
An object that represents a request for payment, including details about payment-processing capabilities, the payment amount, and shipping information.
An array of payment summary item objects that summarize the amount of the payment.
An object that defines a summary item in a payment request, taxes, discounts, shipping, a grand total, and the like.
An object that defines a shipping method for delivering physical goods.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
